docs.title: Overview
docs.text: R3C-library is a modular runtime designed to replace LLVM-dependent components in modern Rust/C++ toolchains.

docs.title: 🧱 Build Process
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/r3c-foundation/R3C-library
cd R3C-library && cmake -B build && cmake --build build

✅ No LLVM required — pure ASM mode.

docs.title: 🤝 Contributing
docs.text:
1. Fork → Branch → PR
  2. Avoid LLVM dependencies.

docs.title: 🦀 No LLVM Philosophy
docs.text: Dependence is comfort. Independence is evolution. R3C-library proves Rust and C++ can run without LLVM or Clang.

docs.title: 🧱 R3C-library Overview
docs.text: “No LLVM. No Middle Layer. Just Metal.”

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text:
R3C-library is the runtime foundation of the R3C ecosystem — a pure C++ / Rust / ASM library that enables LLVM-free builds.

It replaces traditional compiler dependencies with a minimal runtime, custom allocator, and direct ASM interface.

docs.title: Key Goals
docs.text:
• 🦀 Enable Rust builds without LLVM backend
  • ⚙️ Provide no_std compatible runtime layer
  • 🧩 Replace libstd and libc with R3C equivalents
  • 🧱 Integrate with R3C Core, HalRust, and Rust-LTSS
